THTTPManager Class

Summary

This is the base class, which handles the queued access for the HTTP-requests. Every GET/POST request gets a unique number. Through this you can check via HasResult(<UniqueID>) whether a specific request is full-filled or not. If the request is finished [i.e. HasResult(Double) = True], you can call GetResult(<UniqueID>) to access the HTTP-request result.

Be sure to create (using the Instance function) the class before you access it outside of your main application! You can customize (override) the internal constructor Create for your own needs (i.e. connect HTTP logging feature).

Namespace: uHTTPManager
Inheritance Hierarchy
TInterfacedObject
  uHTTPManager.THTTPManager
Syntax
Delphi
type
 THTTPManager = class(TInterfacedObject, IHTTPManager)
 end;

Implementor

OnRequestDone

This event occurs when a HTTP request is processed.

Top
Methods
Show:
 NameDescription
Get(IHTTPRequest,IHTTPOptions)

Overloaded. Adds a new GET-request to the internal queue and returns immediately.

Get(WideString,Double,IHTTPOptions)
Overloaded.

Adds a follow-up GET-request to the internal queue and returns immediately.

A follow-up request is a new request based upon a previous request. All HTTP header information from the previous request like Cookies, CharSet as well as CustomHeaders are copied into this new request.

GetImplementor

Represents method GetImplementor.

GetRequestDone

Represents method GetRequestDone.

GetResult(Double)

This function returns the information about the full HTTP process if completed and nil otherwise.

HasResult(Double)

The function returns True if the given request is processed and False otherwise.

Instance

This returns the single instance to this class. If this class is not created, this functions creates it.

Post(IHTTPRequest,IHTTPParams,IHTTPOptions)

Overloaded. Adds a new HTTP-request to the internal queue and returns immediately.

Post(WideString,Double,IHTTPParams,IHTTPOptions)
Overloaded.

Adds a follow-up HTTP-request to the internal queue and returns immediately.

A follow-up request is a new request based upon a previous request. All HTTP header information from the previous request like Cookies, CharSet as well as CustomHeaders are copied into this new request.

SetImplementor(IHTTPImplementation)

Represents method SetImplementor(IHTTPImplementation).

Wait(Double,Integer)

Represents method Wait(Double,Integer).

Top
Remarks

This class is a singleton.
